body.query: ={{ "select campaign.id, campaign.name, campaign_budget.amount_micros, campaign_budget.period,campaign.status,campaign.optimization_score,campaign.advertising_channel_type,campaign.advertising_channel_sub_type,metrics.impressions,metrics.interactions,metrics.interaction_rate,metrics.average_cost,metrics.cost_micros,metrics.conversions,metrics.cost_per_conversion,metrics.conversions_from_interactions_rate,metrics.video_views,metrics.average_cpm,metrics.ctr from campaign where campaign.id > 0 " + (["allTime", undefined, ""].includes($parameter.additionalOptions?.dateRange) ? "" : " and segments.date DURING " + $parameter.additionalOptions.dateRange) + " " + (["all", undefined, ""].includes($parameter.additionalOptions?.campaignStatus) ? "" : " and campaign.status = '" + $parameter.additionalOptions.campaignStatus + "'") + "" }}

values.name: alias
values.description: An alias for the metric expression is an alternate name for the expression. The alias can be used for filtering and sorting.

values.name: expression
values.description:
A metric expression in the request. An expression is constructed from one or more metrics and numbers.

Accepted operators include: Plus (+), Minus (-), Negation (Unary -), Divided by (/), Multiplied by (*), Parenthesis, Positive cardinal numbers (0-9), can include decimals and is limited to 1024 characters.

Example ga:totalRefunds/ga:users, in most cases the metric expression is just a single metric name like ga:users.

Adding mixed MetricType (E.g., CURRENCY + PERCENTAGE) metrics will result in unexpected results.

.

values.description: Specifies how the metric expression should be formatted

values.description:
Use custom cron expression. Values and ranges as follows:

  • Minutes: 0 - 59
  • Hours: 0 - 23
  • Day of Month: 1 - 31
  • Months: 0 - 11 (Jan - Dec)
  • Day of Week: 0 - 6 (Sun - Sat)

options.name: codeExecution
options.description: Whether to allow the model to execute code it generates to produce a response. Supported only by certain models.

options.name: frequencyPenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim

options.name: maxOutputTokens
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion

options.name: candidateCount
options.description: How many completions to generate for each prompt

options.name: presencePenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls the randomness of the output. Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive

options.name: topP
options.description: The maximum cumulative probability of tokens to consider when sampling

options.name: topK
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to consider when sampling

options.name: maxToolsIterations
options.description: The maximum number of tool iteration cycles the LLM will run before stopping. A single iteration can contain multiple tool calls. Set to 0 for no limit

options.description: Whether to allow the model to execute code it generates to produce a response. Supported only by certain models.

options.name: frequencyPenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim

options.name: maxOutputTokens
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion

options.name: candidateCount
options.description: How many completions to generate for each prompt

options.name: presencePenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls the randomness of the output. Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive

options.name: topP
options.description: The maximum cumulative probability of tokens to consider when sampling

options.name: topK
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to consider when sampling

options.name: maxToolsIterations
options.description: The maximum number of tool iteration cycles the LLM will run before stopping. A single iteration can contain multiple tool calls. Set to 0 for no limit

options.name: valueInputMode
RAW
options.description: The values will not be parsed and will be stored as-is

options.name: User Entered
options.description: The values will be parsed as if the user typed them into the UI. Numbers will stay as numbers, but strings may be converted to numbers, dates, etc. following the same rules that are applied when entering text into a cell via the Google Sheets UI.
Determines how data should be interpreted

options.name: valueRenderMode
Formatted Value
options.description: Values will be calculated & formatted in the reply according to the cell's formatting.Formatting is based on the spreadsheet's locale, not the requesting user's locale.For example, if A1 is 1.23 and A2 is =A1 and formatted as currency, then A2 would return "$1.23"

options.name: Formula
options.description: Values will not be calculated. The reply will include the formulas. For example, if A1 is 1.23 and A2 is =A1 and formatted as currency, then A2 would return "=A1".

options.name: Unformatted Value
options.description: Values will be calculated, but not formatted in the reply. For example, if A1 is 1.23 and A2 is =A1 and formatted as currency, then A2 would return the number 1.23.
Determines how values should be rendered in the output
